intro: Orthodon japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese orthodon, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Orthodon japonicus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
